results.title: Sinnui yauman (A Chinese Ghost Story)
results.creator_credit: Cinema City Co, Film Workshop, Tsui Hark and Ching Siu-tung
results.brief_description: Leslie Cheung stars as Ning Tsai-Shen, a timid tax collector who happens upon the haunted Lan Ro temple where he meets and falls in love with Nieh Hsiao-Tsing a restless ghost (Joey Wong) whose soul is being held captive by a hideous tree demon.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu annd genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Bold and surprising, Jason Phu’s video work presents a guide for surviving contemporary life through martial arts films and classic Chinese philosophy, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese/Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the featured films.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Cinema City Co, Film Workshop, Tsui Hark and Ching Siu-tung
results.description: Leslie Cheung (Happy Together) stars as Ning Tsai-Shen, a timid tax collector who happens upon the haunted Lan Ro temple where he meets and falls in love with Nieh Hsiao-Tsing a restless ghost (Joey Wong) whose soul is being held captive by a hideous tree demon. Enlisting the help of a mysterious Taoist monk (Wu Ma), the young tax collector tries to free the girl’s spirit and lay it to rest before her eminent marriage to the evil mountain demon. Employing rapid editing, surreal imagery (including a demon with a giant killer tongue) and spectacular fight sequences, ‘A Chinese ghost story’ is a fine example of the kinetic energy and outlandish sensibility that is a staple of the Hong Kong fantasy genre. Also starring Joi Wang. In Cantonese with English subtitles.
description_for_label: Leslie Cheung (Happy Together) stars as Ning Tsai-Shen, a timid tax collector who happens upon the haunted Lan Ro temple where he meets and falls in love with Nieh Hsiao-Tsing a restless ghost (Joey Wong) whose soul is being held captive by a hideous tree demon. Employing rapid editing, surreal imagery (including a demon with a giant killer tongue) and spectacular fight sequences, ‘A Chinese ghost story’ is a fine example of the kinetic energy and outlandish sensibility that is a staple of the Hong Kong fantasy genre. Also starring Joi Wang. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
results.creator_credit: Sony Pictures, Columbia Pictures, Good Machine International, EDKO Film, Zoom Hunt International, China Films Co-Production, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, Bill Kong, Ligong Xu and Ang Lee
results.brief_description: An epic love story and action drama set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai and Yu Shu Lien are duty bound warriors whose unspoken love spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu and Lo represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu annd genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Bold and surprising, Jason Phu’s video work presents a guide for surviving contemporary life through martial arts films and classic Chinese philosophy, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese/Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the featured films.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Sony Pictures, Columbia Pictures, Good Machine International, EDKO Film, Zoom Hunt International, China Films Co-Production, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, Bill Kong, Ligong Xu and Ang Lee
results.description: An epic love story and action drama, set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai (Chow Yun Fat) and Yu Shu Lien (Michelle Yeoh) are cast as duty bound warriors whose unspoken love for each other spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu (a promising young warrior) and Lo (her bandit lover) represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love. After Li surrenders his legendary sword to Yu and vows to stop fighting, his plans to retire are halted when the sword is stolen. In their quest to recover it, Li and Yu confront the evil forces headed by Jade Fox who is attempting to recruit the impressionable young Jen Yu to her cause. As the opposing forces of good and evil battle to secure the sword, they also struggle to lure Jen Lu to their side. Based on an early 20th century novel by Wang Du Lu, the project was scripted by Wang Hui Ling, James Schamus and Tsai Kuo Jung. Photographed by Peter Pau. Martial arts choreography by Yuen Wo-Ping. (Awards: Academy Awards 2001, Best Foreign Film, Best Music Score, Best Art Direction and Best Cinematography)
description_for_label: An epic love story and action drama, set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. As the opposing forces of good and evil battle to secure the sword, they also struggle to lure Jen Lu to their side. Based on an early 20th century novel by Wang Du Lu, the project was scripted by Wang Hui Ling, James Schamus and Tsai Kuo Jung. Photographed by Peter Pau. Martial arts choreography by Yuen Wo-Ping. (Awards: Academy Awards 2001, Best Foreign Film, Best Music Score, Best Art Direction and Best Cinematography)

results.title: Police Story 3: Super Cop
results.creator_credit: Golden Harvest, Golden Way, Leonard Ho, Raymond Chow and Stanley Tong
results.brief_description: Jackie Chan is the maverick cop Ka Kui who goes undercover to investigate covert arms and drug deals between mainland China and Hong Kong. Michelle Yeoh plays his partner Yeung and together they embark on an action-packed adventure which is full of amazing stunts and daredevil feats.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu annd genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Bold and surprising, Jason Phu’s video work presents a guide for surviving contemporary life through martial arts films and classic Chinese philosophy, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese/Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the featured films.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Golden Harvest, Golden Way, Leonard Ho, Raymond Chow and Stanley Tong
results.description: Chan Kong-sang, or as westerners know him, “Jackie Chan”, is the maverick cop Ka Kui who goes undercover to investigate covert arms and drug deals between mainland China and Hong Kong. Michelle Yeoh plays his partner Yeung and together they embark on an action-packed adventure which is full of amazing stunts and daredevil feats that will leave you on the edge of your seat. In Mandarin with English subtitles.
description_for_label: Chan Kong-sang, or as westerners know him, “Jackie Chan”, is the maverick cop Ka Kui who goes undercover to investigate covert arms and drug deals between mainland China and Hong Kong. results.title: Drunken Master
results.creator_credit: Seasonal Film Corporation, Zhang Quan and Yuen Woo-Ping
results.brief_description: This 1978 Hong Kong film, one of the earliest to star Jackie Chan, highlights the relationship between a student and his martial arts master.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu annd genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Bold and surprising, Jason Phu’s video work presents a guide for surviving contemporary life through martial arts films and classic Chinese philosophy, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese/Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the featured films.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Seasonal Film Corporation, Zhang Quan and Yuen Woo-Ping
results.description: This 1978 Hong Kong film, one of the earliest to star Jackie Chan, highlights the relationship between a student and his martial arts master. Wong Fei Hung, played by Chan, is a 19th Century folk hero in Chinese culture and cinema, a master of kung fu who fights the injustice of British colonialism (this character would later be portrayed by Jet Li in ‘Once upon a time in China’). Drunken Master finds Wong in his early years as a troublesome fighter who is sent to his uncle, the hard-drinking title character, for instruction in discipline and martial arts. After enduring torturous training, Wong runs away only to encounter some local villains. Being badly beaten, he returns to his uncle who finally trains him in “drunken style” kung fu. Cast includes: Jackie Chan, Simon Yuen and Lam Yin.
description_for_label: This 1978 Hong Kong film, one of the earliest to star Jackie Chan, highlights the relationship between a student and his martial arts master. After enduring torturous training, Wong runs away only to encounter some local villains. Being badly beaten, he returns to his uncle who finally trains him in “drunken style” kung fu. results.title: Cog
results.brief_description: A 2D digitally composited animation, with a distinctive 3D look. The mechanical, metalloid, surreal environment, as well as the characters, were created from real life cut-outs (from photographs) of everyday objects. COG is a parable about the beauty of life being ground down by an industrial society.
